speakers.bio: Jeff is a member of the Google Web DevRel team, based in NYC. His mission is to build libraries that take the work out of using service workers.

speakers.bio: Jenn Schiffer is Community Engineer for Glitch.com at Fog Creek. Along with making art and jokes and apps, she runs the web developer meetup JerseyScript in Jersey City and co-emcees/organizes BrooklynJS, a JavaScript meetup for New York's favorite borough. She is incredibly strong and runs very fast
speakers.name: Jenn Schiffer
speakers.title: Community Engineer, Glitch.com

Along with making art and jokes and apps, she runs the web developer meetup JerseyScript in Jersey City and co-emcees/organizes BrooklynJS, a JavaScript meetup for New York's favorite borough. speakers.bio: Amal has recently join Bocoup as a Sr Open Web Engineer where she will work on web platform interoperability and reliability alongside browser engineers from Google's V8, Mozilla's Spidermonkey and Microsoft's Edge teams. Amal is a biomedical engineer turned software engineer that has a passion for creating delightful applications that make a difference. She is hyper-technical and enjoys having a deep understanding of optimizations and the ‘whys’ behind best practices and patterns. Amal loves to travel and has been to over 30 countries, and speaks four languages. She is also a co-host on the Web Platform Podcast and a co-organizer of Boston's Google Developer Group.
speakers.name: Amal Hussein
speakers.title: Senior Open Web Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Amal has recently join Bocoup as a Sr Open Web Engineer where she will work on web platform interoperability and reliability alongside browser engineers from Google's V8, Mozilla's Spidermonkey and Microsoft's Edge teams.

speakers.bio: Jen Looper is a Senior Developer Advocate at Progress with over 15 years' experience as a web and mobile developer, specializing in creating cross-platform mobile apps. She's a multilingual multiculturalist with a passion for hardware hacking, mobile apps, machine learning and discovering new things every day.
speakers.name: Jen Looper
speakers.title: Senior Developer Advocate

She's a multilingual multiculturalist with a passion for hardware hacking, mobile apps, machine learning and discovering new things every day. Visit her online at http://www.jenlooper.com

speakers.bio: Faisal is a Google Developer Expert, Entrepreneur and Engineer. He is a programming language enthusiast and loves solving software engineering challenges across the stack. Currently Faisal is a Senior Engineer at Zoom.ai, as well as working on side projects in Machine Learning, Android, Dart and Flutter.
speakers.name: Faisal Abid
speakers.title: Google Developer Expert (Flutter, Google Cloud)
speakers.shortBio: Faisal is a Google Developer Expert, Entrepreneur and Engineer. He is a programming language enthusiast and loves solving software engineering challenges across the stack. Currently Faisal is a Senior Engineer at Zoom.ai, as well as working on side projects in Machine Learning, Android, Dart and Flutter.

speakers.bio: Bob (GDE) is a creative technologist and designer who works at the intersection of technology, design, and art. He started his career as a freelance software developer during his art studies, and founded his company Kubrickology right after receiving his bachelor's degree. Bob helps other companies find new business opportunities by implementing and researching new technologies, such as Internet of Things, machine learning, and more. Bob also blogs and makes tech-art installations, which you can read about on his website - or follow his activity on Github. More info at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_van_Luijt​
speakers.name: Bob Van Luijt
speakers.title: Creative Technologist

Bob also blogs and makes tech-art installations, which you can read about on his website - or follow his activity on Github.

speakers.bio: Aaron is the lead software engineer for reCAPTCHA. Prior to Google, Aaron was a Staff Engineer at Jive Software focusing on mobile and third-party APIs. Aaron earned a master's degree from Michigan State University in Computer Science and bachelor's degree from Kalamazoo College in computer science and math.

speakers.bio: Ray is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at RedHat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.

speakers.title: Developer Advocate, Google Cloud

speakers.bio: Doug is a veteran engineer, experienced public speaker, and developer advocate at Google with the Firebase team.  He's been developing for Android since the very first Android device was on the market, and has bootstrapped the efforts of silicon valley startups.  Outside of work, Doug follows professional ice hockey and enjoys craft beer.

speakers.title: Developer Advocate, Firebase

speakers.bio: Kat is the Tech Lead of Cloud Storage for Firebase, previously working on the iOS SDK and backend for the Realtime Database. Kat graduated from MIT with a bachelor's and master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. When she's unplugged, she spends her time dancing, figure skating, and escaping rooms.

speakers.title: Software Engineer

speakers.bio: Stacy is an Android specialist and Mobile Lead at Alkami Techology which recently was named 11th fastest growing software company in the US. She ha worked in almost all aspects of Android development including OS, Frameworks, Radio, and Apps. Stacy also develops IoT appliances and is a maker at heart, developing products from hardware through production. In her spare time, you can find her hacking and restoring arcade or pinball machines or just building custom keyboards!
speakers.name: Stacy Devino
speakers.title: Android Specialist & Mobile Lead

speakers.bio: Macy Kuang is not just the producer and host of her own YouTube technology tips and tricks show - CodeToCreate, she is also the founder of Miaomiao Games. She is on the organizing committee for AndroidTO, the annual Android conference, and the co-organizer of the Toronto Google Developer Group. Macy became a Google Developer Expert for Wearable since 2014 and is now an IoT Pioneer. In early 2017, Macy joins the intel innovator program as an robotic, IoT and VR expert.
speakers.name: Macy Kuang
speakers.title: Founder, Miaomiao Games

speakers.bio: Rebecca Franks the Android Engineering Lead at DVT. She has over 5 years experience in developing Android applications. In March 2016, she was awarded with the status of Google Developer Expert for Android. In her spare time, she works with Book Dash – a Non Profit Organisation – developing an Android app to showcase their free children’s books. She enjoys public speaking and frequently speak at conferences and local meetups. Her blog has been featured multiple times in Android Weekly . In June 2016, She was selected as part of the Mail & Guardian’s Top 200 Young South Africans.
speakers.name: Rebecca Franks
speakers.title: Google Developer Expert (Android, IoT)
speakers.shortBio: Rebecca Franks the Android Engineering Lead at DVT. She has over 5 years experience in developing Android applications. In March 2016, she was awarded with the status of Google Developer Expert for Android. In her spare time, she works with Book Dash, a Non Profit Organisation.

badges.description: Google Developer Expert | Wearables, IoT, Assistant
badges.name: GDE

speakers.bio: Allen is a Senior Project Guru at Objective Consulting (https://spiders.com) where he focuses on helping clients improve their workflows and address their users’ needs using new and upcoming technologies from web, to mobile, to ubiquitous platforms. He has been a Google Developer Expert (GDE) since 2012 and currently specializes in, and loves to help others learn about, Google technologies for identity, wearables, IoT, and the Google Assistant. If you’re looking for him around the conference, you can easily spot him by his blue shirt, his blue Google Glass, and his passion for humanizing technology.
speakers.name: Allen Firstenberg
speakers.title: Senior Project Guru & Google Developer Expert
speakers.shortBio: Allen has been a Google Developer Expert (GDE) since 2012 and currently specializes in, and loves to help others learn about, Google technologies for identity, wearables, IoT, and the Google Assistant

speakers.bio: Mandy Chan is a passionate software engineer who absolutely loves learning and inspiring others to build amazing products. She has developed more than a dozen Alexa skills now and growing number of Actions on Google. Mandy is one of the Alexa Champions since November 2016 because of her early contributions in the Voice Open Source community. One of her most frequently downloaded open source projects is called the SSML-Builder which creates well-formed Speech Synthesis Markup Language without worrying about string concatenations. She continues to share her passion for the voice space by working on her second open source project - SSML-Builder in JAVA. She is also a co-organizer of the NYC Voice Assistant Meetup. You can learn more about Mandy @MandyChanNYC
speakers.name: Mandy Chan
speakers.title: Amazon Alexa Champion, Creator of Open Source SSML-Builder

She has developed more than a dozen Alexa skills now and growing number of Actions on Google. Mandy is one of the Alexa Champions since November 2016 because of her early contributions in the Voice Open Source community.

speakers.bio: Jeff Smith leads the team that builds Amelia, the most comprehensive AI platform for enterprises. He has built bleeding edge technology and awesome teams at various tech organizations across New York, San Francisco, and Hong Kong. He’s a frequent speaker and the author of Reactive Machine Learning Systems, a book on how to build real-world machine learning systems, published by Manning.

speakers.title: Manager, Amelia AI

He’s a frequent speaker and the author of Reactive Machine Learning Systems, a book on how to build real-world machine learning systems, published by Manning.

speakers.bio: Austin is a irredeemable computer nerd who has convinced someone to pay him for it. These days, he's working at the intersection of developing technologies and the enterprise. Outside of that, he's a big fan of live music, road trips, and national parks.
speakers.name: Austin Parker
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Austin is a irredeemable computer nerd who has convinced someone to pay him for it. These days, he's working at the intersection of developing technologies and the enterprise. Outside of that, he's a big fan of live music, road trips, and national parks.

speakers.bio: Mike is Google Developer Expert in Android heavily focused on making performant apps by leveraging functional reactive architectures. He started his Android career 5+ years ago working on logistic software particularly with physical barcode scanners. Since then Mike did a stint at NY's premier Android shop, TouchLab, chased the equity dream at Betterment, fought the good fight at The New York Times and is currently spending his days as the Android Lead at Nike's Digital Innovation Lab S23NC. Mike is also a co-founder of FriendlyRobot.nyc where he helps NY startups turn their dreams into Android realities. In his free time he enjoys writing and speaking about overly complicated concepts at conferences and area meetups, writing for tech blogs and maintaining his open source library TinyDancer, Apollo-Android and NYT Store
speakers.name: Mike Nakhimovich
speakers.title: Android Lead
speakers.shortBio: Mike is Google Developer Expert in Android heavily focused on making performant apps by leveraging functional reactive architectures. He started his Android career 5+ years ago working on logistic software particularly with physical barcode scanners. Since then Mike did a stint at NY's premier Android shop, TouchLab, chased the equity dream at Betterment, fought the good fight at The New York Times and is currently spending his days as the Android Lead at Nike's Digital Innovation Lab S23NC.

speakers.bio: Brian has been developing Android applications for 7 years.  He started out at TouchLab where he worked on a plethora of applications.  This prepared him for the New York Times where he played a pivotal role in rewriting their application from scratch.  Currently he is at Nike's Digital Innovation Lab S23NC focusing on their core application.  In addition to his day job he is also a co-founder of FriendlyRobot.nyc where he helps NY startups turn their dreams into Android realities. He enjoys speaking at meetups and conferences, and working on his open source libraries; NYT Store, TinyDancer, and Apollo-Android.

speakers.bio: Yuliya is an Android developer at Jet.com, leading a team of 4 developers whose main focus is to build performant, scalable and cutting-edge Android projects. Yuliya is actively involved at C4Q - non-profit organization, which fosters the tech community in NY and assists in Android mentoring at Access Code Program.

speakers.bio: Oscar started coding at 12 and has worked in companies of all sizes across the American continent, he has co-founded startups, and worked with a wide range of technologies, worked as a Java Developer for 10 years and since 2008 he has been creating native iOS and Android apps; software written by him is still installed in 50+ countries and serves millions of users.

speakers.bio: Pam Selle is a software engineering lead at IOpipe working with serverless computing as well as a published author and public speaker. She’s author of Beyond the Resume: How to Get Your Next Job as a Developer and lead author of Choosing a JavaScript Framework from Bleeding Edge Press. She’s spoken across the country and internationally, speaking at events including JSConf EU, JSConf US (Last Call), StrangeLoop, and QCon; she also co-founded LibertyJS, Philadelphia’s premier JavaScript conference.
speakers.name: Pam Selle
speakers.title: Software Engineering Lead, IOpipe
speakers.shortBio: Pam Selle is a software engineering lead at IOpipe working with serverless computing as well as a published author and public speaker. She’s author of Beyond the Resume: How to Get Your Next Job as a Developer and lead author of Choosing a JavaScript Framework from Bleeding Edge Press.

speakers.bio: Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate at Google. He's passionate about teaching and education. His interests include Ubiquitous Computing, Machine Learning, and exploring the great outdoors.
speakers.name: Joshua Gordon
speakers.title: Developer Advocate, TensorFlow
speakers.shortBio: Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate at Google. He's passionate about teaching and education. His interests include Ubiquitous Computing, Machine Learning, and exploring the great outdoors.

speakers.bio: Bret is on the Google Cloud Platform team at Google, focusing on developer-oriented products like Google Cloud Functions, App Engine, Compute Engine, machine learning APIs, Firebase and more. He's currently an aspiring Node.js developer. Prior to Google, Bret worked in the cloud industry at Rackspace as a software engineer building the RackConnect hybrid hosting product. Before that, he led engineering teams at e-commerce, non-profit and tried his hand at creating two startups. He's often on the running trail, volleyball court or kickball field. Bret earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Texas A&M University.
